column4: hi folks -- i know there is a replacement for NDISWRAPPER for broadcom wireless cards (4306) but i cant remember it and im not finding it in google / forums - -can someone point me in the right directoin
bcm43xx?
yes
BTW do you use WPA/1/2/PSK?
it was like bcm cutter or something -- i just cant find the docs
no
sudo apt-get install bcm43xx-fwcutter
I'm having problems with that, just thought to try :)
im getting an error from the install process
what kind of?
what command is giving you that error? sudo ndiswrapper -i bcmwl5.inf?
i think whats hapepning is that the installer is going to fetch the firmware and its an old link in the deb package -- and its failing
see http://wiki.ubuntu.com/LaptopTestingTeam/AcerFerrari3400 and download the driver from there, that forks
hate to be a pain but it looks like the site listed in that howto is now dead as well
I used it today myself!
I can download that...
OK, I give you another link
http://www.wildpackets.com/support/hardware/brcm_driver
that has a beta driver, at least it installs OK with ndiswrapper, but is yet to be tested by me...
its all working -- thank you very much!
you're welcome
